"Democracy" - Erik von Ritter Kuenehet—
Leddihn, Austrian journalist, political
scientist and teacher. Lived and taught
in New York City, 1937-1947, Returns 1 to
Austria with wife and children in 1947,
Travels and writes widely of the Internationa
scene. Able linguist.
5 5
"The Refugees, Ten Years Afterward” - Dr.
G. J. van Goedhart, Dutchman, journalist by
profession, died 2 days after interview was
recorded. Fled Holland during the war, and
was active in Dutch Resistances editor of
Het Parol (The Watchword) Dutch Resistance
newspaper. Returned to Holland and jour¬
nalistic life; became chairman of UNESCO
Committee for Refugees, 1950, Committee
awarded Nobel Prize in 3-955.
6 6
"Science and Sin” - Professor Carl Friederieh
von Weizsacker, renowned physicist, who
worked before war with Professor Hand in
Germany on atomic experiments. Grandson
of largest publisher of Lutheran Bible, son
of career diplomat. Corresponded with Lord
Rutherford in England and Einstein in U. S.
7 7
"Errors and Misjudgments of Ity Life" -
Bertrand Russell, mathematician, philosopher.,
essayist, historian, and short story writer,
who has taught and lectured in U. S. as well
as Britain.
8 8
"The Union Movement" - Sir Oswald Mosley,
leader of Union Movement, English Fascist
Party, since middle *30!s. Elected to
Parliament at age of 22 as Conservative;
became youngest Minister for Housing and
Employment, Left Conservatives to join
Labour Party; left Labour Party to form
English Fascist Union Movement Party.
